column11: Review Text

It‚Äôs a nice place to kill some time if you are bored. But there‚Äôs not a lot to do, especially for kids. Food selection is decent, but it‚Äôs all kind of spicy so not a lot of choice for the kids. There‚Äôs a drinks shop that does fruits milkshakes - they were AMAZING. If you want to buy plants, there‚Äôs a huge variety available.
Free player each for kids. Cant take food inside . But felt safe and clean. Food station closeby as well restaurants at waters edge

We went for business  trip to do small gap analysis. I have experienced this place before Zahran attack and post COVID . It was very nice clean and well maintained  unfortunately now place is not maintained well  and most of the shops looks very tired looking Hope business will improve And services level will improve Soon.

column8: Great place for relaxing in colombo
column11: This place is built beside diyawanna oya, comprises of a walking path and a local market place.one can spend a few hours here relaxing. You can buy different varieties of food at restaurants and handlooms, flower pots, ornamental fish ,etc at the market place. You can sit and enjoy any food you bring from outside too.The water fountain is a beautiful scenery at night and try to checkout if possible. Overall a beautiful place in the city to get away from the hassle.
This is a weekend market including open food court and stalls. There is walking path surrounding the water. The  watersedge restaurants are also here. This is crowded during weekends.
This is the best place in colombo to relax ur mind. Jogging track playing areas for the kids also available.

column8: I visited the walking path. That was really great.
column11: The look was really nice with a natural breeze. The place is great to have a rest, to relieve life stress and also for romance.

Diyatha uyana is one of the best places to be in when you need most important relaxation. My self and my family usually visiting this place once we get a time. The best is the environment and the lake near by. That view is just breath taking. Other thing is the food court. You can try various kind of food and beverages. Highly recommended place.

If you ever visiting to see the Parliament this place a good stop specially if its a weekend. It has a nice walking path and on the weekends plants and flower shops. It is surrounding a beautiful lake.

column8: Nice place to buy Exotic flowers üíê and gardening Items
column11: Evey Week End Flower market at Diyathauyana is held with participation of around 100 Venders. Best place around Colombo to buy Orchids. Roses and many varieties of flowers as well as fruits and vegetable plants. Food court there got food through out the day. Walking path and kids play area nearby is very good.

available tracks to walk,and food courts,very good relaxing place in Colombo,friendly place for kids,families,couples, fish therapy place is there,price seems reasonable, attractive place with locals and foreigners

me and my husband went so many times there,really it is a good place with fair rate food,sweat eats,drinks,juices, play area for kids, lovely lake area for loving couples and families,friends ,to relax and fun chat tracks for walks, more locals and foreigners visit the pace for a relaxed evening time,

Diyatha uyana is a well manage public park built along a lake with some shopping stalls and a food court. It is a perfect place for you to spend some relaxing time and it is sprawled across a large area of land. Also it is a great place for children to play and have fun as it has a enormous empty space and a kids‚Äô playing area. However, visit in an evening, but avoid weekends as it is super crowded on those 2 days so you can‚Äôt even walk leisurely through the park.A good free place to relax!!!

A relaxing place that popular amongst morning / evening joggers. Place is bordering the Diyawanna oya. Good for an evening walk with friends and family. They have a food stall with variety of options specially the burgers, Sri Lankan street foods and some Indian menus. What I like the most is the Sri Lankan sweet meet corner that has Helapa and Ginger tea. Saturdays and Sundays park is full with vendors with ornamental products. They have a nice choice of ornamental plants. Nice choice for an evening break.
This is very good place for spend your evening. There are a lot of activities taking place in the weekends and evenings. Food Court is there, fish tanks , walking paths , boats etc.
This is basically active during weekends. There is a street food court and stalls selling fruits plants and ornamental fish.The food court food is cheap but you get expensive restaurants close by.

This a park, which is developed on the bank of the lake, with walkways and lawns. The marshy areas around the lake have been well utilized in the layout, to give it a green and natural appearance. This place is good for relaxing and walking around. The only negative was the dog dropping at many places in the park, and visitors have to mind their steps, while walking around. There is ample parking area near the park. There is an upmarket restaurant on the lake. Area near the parking, just outside the park has been converted into a shopping area, with tent type stalls. There is a beautifully maintained public Aquarium in the center. There are many stall selling different types of food. The stall sell flowers, fruits, plants, horticulture items, gift items, etc. The whole place has been well laid out and managed. We had visited the place on the Saturday afternoon, and the roads leading towards Diyatha Uyana were jammed. The place was visited in vast numbers by locals. It is a good place to relax, even for the tourists.

One can go with kids, as there is a play area for kids, or just to relax near the water. If you are a fitness freak, you can try to impress on-lookers by doing many push-ups. If you are really advised to do a work-out to lower cholesterol, you can do that quietly too.

Lovely  place where it is close to Colombo to walk and relax for healthy life with your family, one part of it is covered by a lake and trees are planted around the park. A beautiful aquarium situate at one side of the park with variety of ornament fish. You can take foods from the restaurants which is located in this areas , but negative fact is that most of are fast food but there are out lets which gives healthy food.

It was a very tired week so badly wanted to be relax by walking in the beautiful environment.We decided to go Diyatha Uyana.As we got down from the vehicle there was a food court to take food and also there was flower sellers too.Then we started to walking towards to Diyatha Uyana walking path/park it look super natural.Actually parking is 100% free and the park look really beautiful with lake.We were there for around 5-6 hours while talking and walking.This is a ideal place to watch the sunset without going to a beach.And also this have a kids park and boats rides.Try to go to this place if you are running in  a busy work time this will make your mind refresh.

If you are looking for a place to get out of your busy schedule and also not too far off Colombo, here is the place. You get a children's park, a restaurant bar, a food court and a lovey view with a lake. It also has a jogging track.

Lovely place to go.they have a very nice and well maintained children's park.no food stuff are allowed to be taken inside.they have a nice boat ride for Rs.50 to go to a lovely train restaurant on the other side.they serve good food and the service was really good.washrooms were very clean too.this was a nice place to spend time at.the children loved it.entrance is FOC.

A very sought out destination to both the young and the old, fitness enthusiast as well as families, Diyatha Uyana is a ideal location for those seeking to unwind from the stresses of city dwelling. The unique thing about the place is that it can cater to the whole cross section of society at the same time. Whether you prefer to have a bottle of expensive red wine or you can only afford to have a cup of tea, the food courts can cater to all. The large play area is ideal for small children to sweat it out. Walking around on the walking tracks, you are sure to burn few calories too.

Diyatha Uyana has turned out to be a popular place for a brisk jog, leisurely walk  or an ideal place to just soak up the splendour of nature  as one gazes at the rippled water of the Diyanannawa. The hawker type  food stalls offer a wide variety of fare, from Indian, chineses, western, Thai and traditional Sri Lankan. Food is served fast, although one may have to jostle ones way to the stall  through the crowd thronging outside. . On weekends , there is lively music provided by military bands and a party atmosphere. Boat rides and tours around the location in brighly painted vehicles are other attractions. The Diyatha Stations , where one has to reach by sailing on a barge is is a hot favourite with our family, Food is served from carriages from  a well done up train parked in a fascinating railway station setting overlooking the lake. The star class quality of Waters edge is maintained . The star class food is priced very nominally. This is indeed a great attraction fo visitors to keep on coming over and over again.
cool place lots of srilankan product and nice restaurant with all kind of food variates . and there is a nice walking path and there is a floating boat with a restaurant .

Nice place near diyawanna oya. Easy access. Good foods.. small cloth shops , good food. Good place to visit .. reasonable price for many of items hands crafts  clothes ..... In holidays more crowd....

I went bird watching at Diyatha Uyana on a morning visit and saw many varieties of birds including pied kingfishers, common sandpipers, paddyfield pipits, grey wagtails, pelicans, purple herons, asian openbill storks, black crowned night herons etc.

this place is really good for a walk bout say no to foods from this place. have tried this place for several times. be aware of foods shops but ice creams , juices and other snacks are fine. try this place in evening time since there are no shades other than the food center .
Diyata Uyana and is beautiful and very clean area I would highly recommended evening street foods & children activities.
Very beautiful urban park, you won't feel that you are in Colombo. Place is busy in the weekends but everyone has something to do there. Best time to go there in the evening.

This place is located by the side of the beautiful Diyawanna oya. Evening breeze is really relaxing. There are food corners to please your appetite!! There is wet land there and I recorded 45 varieties of birds!!.

Even though it is situated in the middle of a busy city, you won't even feel that once you enter there. The place is really calm and relaxing. The lake (Diyawanna Oya) makes it more and more beautiful (I guess you know that Diyatha Uyana is originally a wetland situated on the bank of Diyawanna Oya. It has been developed as a park without disturbing the natural setup much. It is really a good place to have a little walk, to have a chat sitting on a bench at lake, to let your children play a little etc. Further, there are a aquarium, lots of shops related to gardening (and more), a cafe, a children's play area and a jogging track. It will be ideal to visit this place early in the morning or in the evening. Avoid visiting at day time, because there are not much shades.

Located near the Diyawanna river. A good place to visit with your family and friends. There is a walking  path , play area and an aquarium. Children can ride bicycles, scooters. There is enough parking but some days It's so crowded. There are some good restaurants and shops.
This is a nice place to hang around.A good walk and running path.A good place to have a snack or meal.A good area for family and friends.

Colombo is crowded with most number of working people. This place give some refreshment to workers and students in the busy environment. I think the place will be more developed and more facilitated in the future. Have a rest  in your busy life for a while.

Another scenic perspective of peaceful Diyawanna river eco system, this wonderful recreational park nestled in the Sri Jayawardanapura sanctuary, close by Battaramulla town. 24 x 7 park with different tastes in it, that would enjoy anyone who visit here, including long sandy walking paths for jogging in the morning or in the evening, a dedicated huge children's park for kids, nicely arranged cement benches and tables that suit for lovers and families, an aquarium for those who love them, eye catching lush greenery and cold breeze from Diyawanna river for nature lovers and many more. Mostly, people used to come here in the evening. The entrance is entirely free. It is facilitated with a spacious vehicle park.  It is bit crowed in weekends. At the very entrance there are some restaurants. The staff is really good. You can enjoy a fruit juice or your evening tea  under the shade of Nadun trees. No one is there to disturb you. Next to this plot, there are agricultural and horticultural shops which provide you a great range of flowering plants, ornamental plants, cacti, orchids, agricultural plants and seeds, Bonsai fertilizers and equipments. The circular aquarium also located near by which displays uncommon exotic fish species including aligator gars, piranhas and many more. Since this is a wetland it is home for many a species of aquatic birds. So bird watchers and nature photographers will love this place. You can easily spot waterhens, lap wings, pelicans, eagrets, several species of kingfishers, cormorants, darters and bee eaters. Another attraction here us floating restaurant which is maintained by Sri Lanka Navy. You can have a night boat ride in which you will enjoy peace in the dusk.
Very nice place in the evening. Spacious with a cold breeze. Range of food chose from. A good walk and a hangout. Can have a good run and excersise in the morning. Nice place to have a chill.

We took our nieces to the play area, they loved it. There are also food stalls and some shops on certain days (I was told). Some nice large fish tanks that you can enjoy free of charge too. Gets very busy in early evenings, so get there slightly early sit in the shade then enjoy the evening walk after the sun hits the water.

Beautiful garden with large children's play area, jogging tracks and relaxing areas, before the entrance to the garden you find a market with food vendors, garden equipment and plants vendors and various other stalls selling souvenirs, clothing and vast selection of other items interesting for foreign tourists to explore the local culture and buy some to take back home
This park is nicely built, along with facilities for small kids. There are plenty of food vendors at the place, with variety of cuisines. The walking path is well planned and built.
Even though little crowded in weekends, its  a good place to have some family time. Have some good food outlets too.
Located in official capital of Sri Jayawardanapura fully naturally & wonderful location there is an amazing scenic view of the diyawannawa lake.
This is the best place to relax in Colombo. Well maintained and clean. Children will absolutely love it as they have enough space to run/ walk. Good for bird watching also.
Nice.. has a lot of shops for snacks....and has a variety of shops selling plants.....the huge fishtanks are also nice..
A park to relax. Great for a stroll and to check out the outdoor markets. Strongly suggest to visit during sunset to witness beautiful views of the Diyawanna Lake.

Diyathu uyana is one of the main places that attracks local visitors. Depend on the people you visit you can adjust the activities you are going to do there. If you are planning to with your friends you can have a chit chat in several places and enjoy the food from the food court. If it's a evening date you can cuddle with your partner in the lovers area. If you are planning to visit the place with children dont worry there is a play area for them to have fun while you relax. A plant sale is happening every weekend where you can buy soil, plants, flowers, pots n all most everything you need to do gardening.

column7: Emirate of Sharjah, United Arab Emirates
column11: This is a pretty good to take you evening walk and do some shopping or have your dinner even.but please remember to keep your identity document with you.since this place in a secured environment there could be a random check.

Visited this garden on a Sunday morning. It was hot, sunny and pretty crowded. However, it was still an enjoyable stroll through the garden amongst the locals. I am not sure if it is permanent or a weekend phenomena, but there were a large number of nursery or plant sellers. And everyone seemed to enjoying shopping samplings and plants of beautiful varieties. There is a food court selling varieties of food; we tried it too. However, the sitting area is an open cemented table-stool arrangement with little shade from the scorching heat. And that was tough. However, a visit to this garden early morning or at dusk would solve this problem. A walking trail besides the lake with some storks fishing in the waters, was very soothing and calming. The park may not be very unique to foreign travellers, but is still a must visit if one has time in hand.
My kids love this place. Good place to enjoy the evening with few good shops around for eat out. There are plant shops selling many varieties of plants. Love this place.

Its in the eastern suburbs . Ample parking n food stalls available Newly laid children's play area with seating along the man made lake. There is a small aquarium besides the shopping area Overall a nice experience and plan to spend over an hour here.

This is ideal place people to visitors tourist's who looking around colombo, to stay while, and relax. Food, Long walk, Some 3D street arts (Shaded need to re-painting), Boat riding, Nice and clean place, with some nature friendly environment. I visited with tourist who had little time before catch the flight. They really enjoyed it the the last moment leaving Sri Lanka.

the place is relaxing but gets crowded in weekends and fridays mostly. People join to jog, exercise and have a snack in the evening. Still you can find a place to sit and relax or enjoy time with your family.

This park which is located in Kotte is easily accessible even by bus.The surrounding is really beautiful with the view of diyawannawa lake.There are boat services available for the public and there's a restaurant in a boat which needs prior approval. There's a food court with authentic Srilankan food to international cuisine for reasonable prices.There's another restaurant called Broad walk which is with more standards with all the bar drinks and the view there is amazingly peaceful. The good market which is run by local sellers have anything and everything.Everything you want to do gardening,plants,organic fruits and vegetables,clothes etc is on sale everyday. Talking about the walking tracks they are the best in town.it gets crowded mostly in weekends and public holidays. But nothing can change the peaceful environment.You get to see so many people jogging around every morning n evenings.You find tranquility along the walking paths more n more when u walk.
A great place to visit within the administrative capital of Sri Lanka. Relaxing environment next to diyawanna Oya, an aquarium and good food.

A serene atmosphere to take a break from a long day. You can walk or just get lazy in many of the concrete chairs out doors. If you want food there is a food court with an amazing variety and if you want dine in then you have the watersedge restaurant with cool music and good food. Shopping area is not always full but you can buy unusual stuff from there. Weekends its crowded but on weekdays no so much. Overall a nice place to hand out.

Within the park there is Ape Gama a representation of how Sri Lankan villages used to look and operate.  There are some classic buildings showing the skill of previous generations in building shelters from the environment. The village is well laid out and easy to stroll around. there are a number of retail outlets but when we visited NO hard sell. At 700 rupees entry definitely worth it.
It is one of the most famous and main park of the Colombo, spread over a huge area with a lot of attractive path way. It is very much famous among locals as a picnic spot

Nice paths and scenery to walk around on a nice day. Paths are surrounded by pools of water which look almost natural. Large and small fish can be seen in the water surrounding the paths, but there is a small range of Aquariums nearby filled with several fish. In addition to the small shops (which do not force you to buy stuff) selling plants and aquarium fish, there is also a food stall with a selection of different food to eat. However, it was quite busy when I went and there is roads with some traffic nearby. So it may not be completely silent and peaceful, but it is still a nice break from the city buildings.
Wonderful park in Colombo. I visits here frequently for many purposes. It's best place to relax and have a peaceful mind. Also food court there is also good.

Its a beautiful park where you can relax while having fun. The aquarium in the park is really great and the good market provides you with clothes, crafts, plants, vegetables and fruits, ornamental fish and accessories etc. You can also find lot of alligators in the park too. Its a very good photo location in Colombo. You can go with your children and spend a day or an evening as there are good stalls and restaurants too. I would highly recommend this place to any one

Located in the vicinity of the Water's Edge Battaramulla, Diyatha Uyana is a gem embedded in the heart of the city. It is a man made greenery where you tend to forget that it is Colombo. The walking paths and the dashing waters at a side, the well maintained grass and the planted trees are perfect supporters of your joy jog even if you're alone or with a crowd. Parents love bringing their kids in here as there's so much to feel in this child friendly environment. There's an aquarium which I personally don't like to visit as I do not like to see caged animals. Plus there are shops nicely lined up which offer food and drinks, souvenirs, gifts, flowers, handicrafts, plants, toys and many more. Seating area is simply amazing that surprisingly you will not see a bit of waste or food leftovers on the floor. Myself and friends frequently visit there and we find many wedding photo-shoots; not to mention how odd looking they are. No matter how much crowd is there your privacy will not be disturbed by them. Nobody will even care to look at you for they are so busy to enjoy the wonderful experience of the site. There is a section where you will see the Deer, Stag,Tortoise, Ducks and a few more animals for the sight of visitors. The water ways that surrounds the section contains some wild fish which I don't know the name of. That was the most stunning experience of the visit I had. You will find McDonald's once you exit the park and even if you're using public transport you not be hassled as the buses go right in front of the park. If you're coming by private transport, the site has a parking area s well.

This river wetlands Park at the heart of Colombo is like a natural elements sanctuary.  Colombo is a city packed with well maintained natural Park.  This is one of the largest and best of them Diyatha Park is a must visit to go roam around go boating see the open aquariums,  just sit talk and have something to eat with friends and family. Recommended.

Highly recommended place around Colombo if you want to take break. With the beautiful view of Diyawanna Lake it's absolutely gem for the city. The "Good Market" come live twice per week. I don't remember the exact days. Large parking space available. But mostly crowded at night. But don't worry place is bigger to handle a large crowed. If you are a jogger , there is a nice and long jogging track there. If you are looking for food, there are several food outlets of famous restaurants there. Nice view, street paintings, birds.. it's beautiful and nice place.

I went there in October. It was a memorable day because same night I am flying. But it was a nice place to spend ur time with ur friends. There is so many nice views. And the food coot was a very nicely located. We spend thin there.
Wow it was a sunny day and it was great to have relax breakfast from diyatha uyana .. Good food and very relaxing .. I prefer to go every morning for breakfast :)

It is a flower market with a food court, a fountain in the middle of a garden, a small space dedicated to organic fruits and vegetables.. It is perfect for you to have a break from the exhaustive daily routine. I've been there twice and I loved to walk all over the market and see those beautiful flower pots and trees. If you have kids, you will make them happy. Plenty of space for them to run and play. There is also a lake nearby and a sidewalk. It would have been great to go for a walk on that sidewalk adjoining the bridge, but it was raining both afternoons.The aquarium is not a plus, yet not disgusting.

Today was a busy day and wanted to go to a place to relax ... and just went to Diyatha Uyana with my wife and Kid . It was great place to have a walk and some food .stood for about 2 hours and had a Kotthu. My kid enjoyed the water fountain and the fish that was in the Tanks ... I recomend all that it was a great place to visit in the evening .....
There's a huge lake called Diyawanna Oya, just a short walk away from The Good Market. It is helmed by a large park, a lovely and clean place for a leisurely stroll.

This is a great recreational park for every good person to hang out with their friends and family. There are some good restaurants to buy food and enjoy them under sunshine or shelter. The place the day I visited could be seen nicely maintained. There are some ponds, lakes and beautiful landscapes could be seen. I suppose place is more crowded on weekends. Week days are ideal for a long resting hours. A market is available for variety of goods. Security personnel could be seen in my visit and they monitor people and the environment. A Good place in town to chill out.
This is close to the Sri Lankan parliament. A good place for an evening walk hang around with friends and family.

These type of places are not found in most places of sri lanka. It is like a countryside experiance in a middle of a metropolis. It is a mordernized but enjoyable and great place to breath fresh air. You can see a lake (diyawanna oya)where people enjoy by riding boats. And anyone can see the awesome fish tanks with fish and the beautiful fountain and when you feel hungry you can grab something from the food corner where u can enjoy many delicious types of food. There is space for vehicle parking and space for regular physical exercises,free walks too. Normally it is crowded cause when ever they are free they run to this place to feel free for sometime.

Located next to Diyawanna Oya and the Parliament of Sri Lanka, it takes only approx: 15-20 minutes drive from Colombo. This is an ideal place for you to relax with the greenery around, if you are stuck between concrete this is the place to sit by the lake and relax. Entrance is free of charge.
Evening to hand around with kids . Parents can jog while kids can play.  Natural beauty / variety of food. Highly recommended.

It's a nice place for an evening stroll or jog. plenty of seats to sit and chat or relax by the water. pets are not allowed and neither is food or drink. But there is a food court and a McDonald's at one end and a Burger King at the other plus a restaurant called the Boardwalk that serves alcohol. There's also a drive through bakery where you can sit and enjoy a good cup of coffee with cakes or pastries and a Italian and Japanse restaurant inside Water's edge with panoramic views of the area and good food.

I think I picked the wrong day to check the place out. There were less than 10 sellers and the weather wasn't helping. Bit disappointed as it was my first visit (on a week day). Haven't given up on it though, will keep going back.

Walking paths,  jogging track, fresh breeze from the surrounding waterways. A variety of exotic birds chirping and fishing among the beautiful water plants.  Turtles basking in the sunlight,  monitor lizards winding their way through the waters. A good selection of food available at the reasonably priced food court,  with plenty of space in the sitting area outside. The "Ranbatha"  organic Sri Lankan food outlet is our favourite,  with healthy yet tasty rice and curry. Another place in the food court offers traditional herbal drinks and porridges with  choice of traditional Sri lankan sweets. Fish tanks on display,  and different vendors plying their wares at a mini market nearby. A decent plant show / sale on,  too. Well worth a visit,  with family for at least 2-3 hours. Ample parking about 600 m away,  with shuttle service for those who prefer not to walk.

Great location, amazing windy weather during evenings, less crowded towards waters edge hotel backyard. free entrance park. well maintained. Good location to catch up with friends and family and a paradise for kids

Diyatha Uyana has been designed for people to have a wonderful relaxed evening ... with a peaceful surrounding, trees and the lake creates a perfect relaxing evening for you and your family .... With their own food court and juice bar you wont be feeling hungry at all ... There are toilets, and they are clean ... I really liked the time I spent there but with regard to parking space there's small issues specially if it is a weekend ... so better go there bit early ....
absolutely amazing lake view with jogging, cycling are and there is a huge food court which has a lot of selection of cuisines. nice place to visit with friends and family.
a great place to spend a nice evening with family an friends.....the food is great as well !!!!!!!!!

A relaxing park with a jogging/cycling area. Perfect to crash in a weekend evening with friends or family. Perfectly maintained, and surrounded by the amazing diyawannawa lake. Good to go even with kids, as the place is secured with security officers, and has a car park which can fit in a few hundred vehicles easily. A bit overly crowded at times, but the vast area will offer you some place to sit back and relax.
Visited the place during our Christmas holiday. Place is next to Waters Edge and very easy access with ample parking. Lots of fish to see and lovely done up the area. Kids will love it!

Food is Ok but not cheap.At present busy during weekends.Weekdays no other vendors.Can find fresh vegetables and fruits,plants and flower shops,ornamental fish vendors during weekend.But too crowded during evening.

This park and the surrounding is the most beautiful city environment that anybody can think of in Colombo. The park is very close to the Parliament, Water‚Äôs Edge Hotel, Ape Gama (a traditional village setup), and nature parks and to many restaurants. The park consist of a food court, mini market, an aquarium, jogging track and shopping stalls (changes every or every other day), boat rides, boat restaurants, sea plane bay, boat cycles, a big parking area  etc, The area is fast changing every day to be a nature city. My only worry is that this place is fully crowded from evening to late night.
We went there for a late afternoon stroll and found the walkways and the surrounds enjoyable. The food stalls served some yummy treats both local and foreign.

Situated in Colombo, this lung space is a destination for many families to gather and spend some time together. From morning walkers to the lazy shoppers for plants, vegetables and fruits and curios, the place has something for everyone

It is more close to our house and most of sundays we visit there. fish tank, food stores, plants shops are really good. the corner near to waters edge with deers, rabits and swans and ducks are really cool place to spend hours.

A nice and serene place to visit for walking and jogging or just a lazy stroll with family and friends...best time of the day to visit is during the early hours or late evening as the sun is not that hot...plenty of seating area but less shades...not to missed the 3D drawings on the walking path however you need a lot of patience as people tends to hoard the drawings for themselves and will not move. Forget to mention that there are stalls and booths right at the park entrance where they sell food, drinks, ornamental plants, gardenning equipments, fishes and fruits. There is also a Foodcourt where they are selling snacks, drinks and even breakfast, lunch and dinner. The entrance into this park is free however surprise awaits you at the park entrance...you are NOT ALLOWED to bring in foods, drinks and ciggarettes in the park. Moreover the security personnel there is just point blank and rude. She will ask you to open your bags, your earlier purchases...dig with all her might till the bottom of the bags, unwrap paper wrapped souvenirs and she will searched your bags for these "prohibited" food items without informing what is the purpose for the search at first! No signage or anything and it is just an iron barricade at the entrance. My local collegues are trying to explain that we do not have items that she is trying to find but she wouldnt listen and everyone watches her frantic search. They even went to the extend of doing random spotcheck of ladies handbags in the park area! They do not respect people's privacy. So forget about having picnic or snacking within the park area...and they should have proper signages at the park entrance as the securities personnel does not speaks English. I do respect people's shortcomings but please be a little bit courteous and respect people's privacy.

Battramulla area has been transformed completely in the last 5 years. An once unattractive marshy area just outside Colombo now is a beautiful public park with Walkway and open air market plus food court. Ample parking too. Now what I like to see is better public transport system to connect with the City. Using and creating waterway is one option and stylish way to travel. Monorail perhaps? Dedicated bicycle lanes? Right now, majority of the people that don't own cars have to depend on over crowded bus service and air polluting tuk tuk to get there.

This is a newly built area just out of Colombo. Make sure you visit here during a less traffic time. We got caught to traffic on our way back but just keep this in mind. As for the attraction it was wonderful. We also had nice meal at a near by restaurant. Overall a lovely place.
Its wonderful how a marshy land has been made into such a lovely place, very famous for plant sales & other small scale  Market place..Well worth a visit.

Located in the close proximity to the Commercial City of Colombo and the Official Capital of Sri Jayawardhanapura Kotte Diyatha Uyana is a wonderful location to visit due to number of reasons. There is an amazing scenic view of the Diyawanna lake amidst the urban environment of Colombo at this location while enjoying various Cuisines at several eateries and Organic food and beverages for the health conscious parties too. The location is cleaned and maintained well in order to make the presence of its visitors a pleasant experience. And also there is an aquarium with various fish types and flowers and plants for viewing and purchase for horticulture enthusiasts. Located very closer to the Trip Advisor award winning Water's Edge Hotel 'Diyatha Uyana' has ample parking area with solar powered park lights. It is not only a hangout location but a eco friendly, green concerned and affordable destination to refresh your mind within minutes.

A simple concept of combining a Market place, a food street, a few attractions in the form of a Lake View, An Aquarium and a garden. The venue is also hosts the Organic "Good Market" on Several Thursdays, where there is even live music, exhibitions and sales on.

If you are in or around Sri Jayawardenapura, Kotte you could start the day at Diyatha Uyana with a leisurely stroll or a brisk walk to keep you fit. The walk way is of gravel, brick and green path of around 3 kms. The lush greenery and the birds are a feast to eyes while you can breath clean fresh air coming over the Diyawanna Lake. After your morning walk you can enjoy a fresh glass of Kola Kanda or a ginger garlic porridge to clean your system from the food stalls followed by a hearty breakfast of traditional rice or kurakkan pittu which keeps your cholesterol levels down. If you visit during the afternoon of the end of the week you can buy many varieties of plants for your garden. In the evening you can come and laze around with your family and enjoy a dinner at the food stalls which present Chinese, pizza and macaroni or local speciality koththu. Although a bit crowded you can stroll around in the cool sorroundings of Diyawanna Lake.

The place was newly built by the government and many thanks for them fo doing so. The park is sarounded by wetland area and is next to the "waters edge". A small aquarium with shark pups which is really interesting, a food court and sitting area, walking path and a big car park, shpoing area for vegies, fruits, hand made local products and flowers. A nice place to spend an afternoon or evening with a fountain in the middle with lights and music with water  effects. One minus point a lot of people specially weekends.

It is an open area in Ethulkotte - Battaramulla (close to the Water's Edge), to chill and spend the evenings. Highly recommend the views when sun sets by the water. For those jogoholics, this place gives you an opportunity to jog by the lake. A popular hangout for pre-wedding photo shoots, where some mornings are totally occupied by a number of wedding groups. This place also features a variety of angles and shots for those shutterbugs. So go try them out!

When I feel the blues coming or when I just need to get some fresh air this is where I go. An excellent place especially in the evening for a leisurely stroll with the better half and to sit on one of em seats by the lake and just chill. Plenty of space to walk,jog and for your kids to play. Food is not great but good and there's variety. And then there are the flower/plant shops for the green lovers and also other items such as garments, household items, tools etc. This place is packed on weekends and parking would be a problem unless u resort to Waters Edge car park and there are golf carts that transport you from there to the park.

This is a place where you can spend your evening or early night with your friends or family. Lot of seating facility (Can't move them as per your wish) some with table facility. You can walk or jog around this place which is laid with nice pavement and plants. The lake and the small marsh land around it gives you freshly breezing air with perfectly fitted night lamps during the night time. Very nice parking facility, well ventilated and maintained WC, available separate for men and women. There is posh restaurant while in the center of the park there is a food court which serves short eats to rich food dishes through many outlets. Clean atmosphere, so you too don't litter on the ground. Just use the cement's bins placed all around the site. If you visit there on a day time you can view large water tanks with large glasses and beautiful fishes. Like wise on the right side of the park there is a road with many 3 D art works. Just stay at the correct spot marked in Yellow color to get the perfect 3D view of the running river, waterfall and broken road. Some of the art work had lost their charm due to faded paint. But worth to give a visit. There are boat services too available while some open small coaches too available to take you round the place with perfect viewing. Sunday evening to night can be spent here with full of activities and you can have soft drinks and meals from the outlets.. The place can be reached by public transport too as it is located next to a main street.

This is situated at Jayawardanapura (Sri Lanka's administrative capital) Parliament also situated close to this place. This is close to Colombo it is about 10 Km from Fort. This Diyatha Uyana is situated at the entrance of the city (near to Waters Edge Hotel) There are lots of kiosk selling from plants to household items near the main road once you pass that you have this walking path its a good place to chill out in the day time not much of a park but a place next to Lake very greenery and clean.  Don't miss the 3D art on the road and to take photos. You fetch a meal from different eateries. On Fridays and Weekends this place is full of local crowd. Nice to see a city green patch. If you have some time to spare its worth to see the locals. There is entrance fee. There are lots of public transport to this place even a tuk tuk should not cost more than LKR 500-600 Lankan Rupees from fort.

a. One of the best out door entertainment sopt wita magnificent viewand many options. b. Good effort by the Govt/ Sect defense to initiate this projects now spreading to many areas Islandwide. c. All inclusive hot spot- food, lovely ambient, walking / jogging, shopping and eating.

We went to this park for the day. There is a big flower display where vendors sell plants and accessories. It was nice to just walk thru and see the flowers. Lots of water around and we saw some people swimming in the big lake area. There is a food court with a lot of variety.....local cuisine, ice cream (which was nice in the heat), Italian, Indian, American, etc. Everything we tried was good. There is also a nice restaurant looking over the lake called Boardwalk, but I dont know if the food was good.  There are lots of tables but not enough trees. There are some shady areas that are nice to picnic, but they are grabbed up quickly. There is not much to do, just scenery and food. But it was nice to relax for a few hours.

Vey active on Friday, Sat, Sun, Flower and related items sale, Fruits and Veggie sale, Food court, Music, Lots and Lots of local sri Lankan families, its a mess in a good way, parking about 200 meters away, need to park and walk as the transit buggy takes time, foo outlets of all sorts Kottu, Chicken, Waffle, Pizza, Burgers, etc etc, prices range $ 4 to $ 8 a meal per person, good to mingle with local sri lankans for a little while, not a repeater for me....
Really thank full to Gotabaya Rajapaksha for his great job done for the public.Lovely place to be.It`s a place for the whole family too.
A few street 3D arts can be seen in here. And there is water pond around the place. A good place to spend the evening...

It's a ideal place for relaxing and specially for family time. Kids can play, parents can walk. While sitting on a bench, having a look on 'Diyawanna' lake, you can enjoy a beautiful evening. Not only this, food court with many selections, small aquarium, flower shops....many more. And more over you can buy fresh fruits and vegetables too. Its a place which gives time for you and your family. :-)

This place is very good for family outing in the evening time and spend your valuable time with your kids and family partners. Very nice place. you can relax and listen music (especially on Saturdays) and  walk around the park. There are number of food stalls and other shopping places to buy some fruits, vegetables, flowers, and etc...

With lake, park and a mini Aquarium its nice place for a family outing. From public walking areas to the weekly Good Market, Diyatha Uyana is a beautiful addition to the city. The food court is open until late making this a nice place to spenda few hours at.

Diyatha Uyana is quite an interesting place with a nice concept.You can find almost everything you need at the good market. The food court is reasonably priced, plenty of seating areas and a good place for families especially especially the mums.Kids love the kids aquarium. You find plants, fruits, vegetables, garden tools, fertilizer, flower pots, clean toilets, etc. Also the walkway is another attraction in the evenings.A new trend for newly weds for there photo shoot overlooking the lake. The only problem is the parking area.
its a very nice place to walk around and relax. the market is open on Thursdays and you can buy a lot of interesting stuff.

have been here a lot of times.... it's very crowded during weekends and Thursdays since the good market. how ever there are a lot of food vendors who sells food for a reasonable price and for pre schoolers there's ample space for ride a bike, small car, skate. ..etc also the walking path is great for couples to have a chat and walk around, also they can sit and have a nice chat by the river. ... be careful of the security personal since they think that a couple kissing each other is a crime. ...!!!! for a family u can enjoy the view of the river, play on the grass area, enjoy the animals in the Water's Edge park.... overall nice place to hangout for any person

The latest tend in Colombo, Diyatha Uyana is a new concept to the area and is a great place to walk around. The 3D walkway is a wonderful experience for children and the location is well done up. Very relaxing in the evenings and has a huge collections of plants to purchase. A food court is available with all sorts of food to chose from but gets crowded specially during the weekends..a great place for a family outing...
They have renovated the place very well and the 3d pictures on the road are very funny and very nice for photography. Easy access to Waters Edge

When we are doing city tour in Colombo ,we went here.It is good place for to take images using 3 D road , relaxation etc.... Actually it is good for families to spend time & enjoy verity of food. Entire tour was organized by Kanota Tours

place is beautifully designed for people to hang around with family. also has a good walking track around the diyawannawa pond. on Thursdays try out the Good Market where you can grab something freshly made and enjoy the surroundings.

It's a good place for a morning jog, but not recommend at the evening because it becomes crowded. Best time to go is before 9 o'clock in the morning and after 4 o'clock in the afternoon. There are few food outlets you can buy any sort of food. Mostly Sri Lankan food. And also there is another restaurant/pub where  you can reserve also. (Mr. Sepa - Boardwalk Restaurant -+94 -779090120). Good place to hang out with family and friends at the evening.

I was always longing for this kind of place in Colombo and was thinking why we dont have such parks here in Sri Lanka. This is a good solution and people enjoy the place that is greatly planned and the atmosphere is well maintained and the evenings are breathtaking with the sunset and the lake view. There are food stalls and you can have an open air dinner with your family. Kids enjoy the very small aquarium. Go on a Thursday for good market or on weekends for other family fairs that sell stuff at reasonable costs.

This is one of the newly built recreational areas in Colombo. Situated in a wetland an ideal place to relax and enjoy the evening with your family, specially it would be ideal to visit when the goods market is open. On weekends it tends to get crowded, but with newly build parking area, it is relatively less parking hassle compare to few months ago. The only disappointment is unprofessional and extremely arrogant security stuff who keep interfering into your relaxation with various commands such as where to sit, where to walk‚Ä¶etc. Therefore despite all investments made into making the park a relaxation area, it gets a lower rank compare to places like independent square
You must visit this place, nice , clean ,green atmosphere and surroundings.well maintaining by the crew. you even can enjoy swan boat riding just nearby. again recommended for any person

This is located just adjoining Water's Edge Hotel. Very nice sceneries. Noted lot of newly weds come there for photographs. Excellent for evening or Morning walk. Now food outlets too available. And there are enough places to sit and have meals. Also there is a beautiful Aquarium with lot of l fish.  Recommended for any body for an outing.

A place where one can sit and relax to the calm sounds of nature with in a busy city area. Very finely maintained and facilities too are very good. There are restrictions on eating food in some areas so if you visit the location and not too sure of it.. please ask someone or follow the signs.

Exhausted?? Hectic work?? Try the place with perfect greenery and a lake running by. Love the atmosphere and also good for a healthy jog. You could also try the food stalls available ranging from achcharus to ice-creams. I wish there were more in Colombo. Love it...

Very beautiful place surrounded with green fields and a lake. Food court and small aquarium also available in the area. Nice view with lots of birds. I love this place very much. Keep in mind that parking is a headache on weekends since lots of people are coming.

Absolutely refreshing and beautiful. Definitely a place to visit. Loved the view, and the place. The variety of food that's there is good, you can chose from a small pastry, all the way to curry and rice. Great place to spend a joyful day :)

The walkway by the lake is very refreshing. The walking track is being extended around waters edge hotel, creating a nice long walking path. Plenty of grass and recreation space for kids and family. The food court has a nice variety of food, though the service time can get to be a bit long during weekends when the place gets filled up. The plant market has quite a wide variety of flowers, herbs and and other plants. The fruit and vegetable market produce too looked quite fresh. The aquarium and fountain are good to keep kids occupied. A nice big car park has been created about 200 yards away with plenty of parking space. There is even a electric shuttle between the food court and the car park.

"Diyatha Uyana" in the Sinhala language (the garden by the water) is the result of a renovation and upgrade of the water's edge located a hop before you reach the country's parliament. This recreational attraction consists of beautiful reservoir banks with interlock paved boardwalk surrounded by ever green grass, flea market style marketplace, an open air food court, plenty of paved parking, a fountain that keeps the kids intrigued with its colorful display of water jets at night, a floating restaurant and an aquarium under the tent. The water body itself serves an important purpose of draining and storing floodwater. It has been comprehensively dredged for effectiveness and now attracts small sailboats and oarsmen practicing recreational and competitive rowing. Swimming is not advised here and probably not allowed. This is a busy attraction with people lounging on the grass, families visiting with children while others seem to stop by for supper. Busiest times are evenings with traffic queueing up for parking as the sun sets. It is advisable to avoid this attraction whenever there is a function in the area involving VIP convoys, to avoid unannounced diversions, restrictions on movement and the general inconvenience of panicked policing. The marketplace offers goods that sell fast and carry items like the Rangala House range of sun-dried tomatoes, tahini etc. The food court offers some diversity but an evident lack of quality control and standards mean you should exercise prudence in your choice. There is no fee for this popular attraction and it is a good opportunity to observe a subsection of Sri Lankan society. It is safe for families and kids but beware of your belongings. The boardwalk offers the opportunity for a brisk walk or jog while you take turns entertaining the kids. Enjoy the corniche!

This is a fascinating green garden among the concrete jungle in clombo and ideal place to fun-filled family outing. It has something for big and small kids. This place was absolutely clean and it has an open air food court with several options.
